title: 1961년 Williams v. State 사건
summary: 미국 Maryland, MD 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Williams v. State. 판결일: 1961-11-08. 법원: Court of Appeals of Maryland.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: WILLIAMS Et Al. v. STATE
**판결일**: 1961-11-08
**법원**: Court of Appeals of Maryland
**관할**: Maryland, MD

**판사**: Henderson, Hammond, Prescott, Horney and Marbury

## 변호인

Samuel W. Barrick and Marvin Mandel, with whom were Mandel and Franklin, and Charles A. Reese on the brief, for the appellants., Robert S. Bourbon, Assistant Attorney General, with whom were Thomas B. Finan, Attorney General, Robert S. Rothenhoefer, State’s Attorney for Frederick County, and T. Hunt Mayfield, State’s Attorney for Howard County, on the brief, for the appellee.

## 인용

- 174 A.2d 719
- 226 Md. 614

## 판결문 요약


226 Md. 614 (1961)
174 A.2d 719
WILLIAMS ET AL.
v.
STATE
[No. 47, September Term, 1961.]
Court of Appeals of Maryland.
Decided November 8, 1961.
*617 The cause was argued before HENDERSON, HAMMOND, PRESCOTT, HORNEY and MARBURY, JJ.
Samuel W. Barrick and Marvin Mandel, with whom were Mandel and Franklin, and Charles A. Reese on the brief, for the appellants.
Robert S. Bourbon, Assistant Attorney General, with whom were Thomas B. Finan, Attorney General, Robert S. Rothenhoefer, State's Attorney for Frederick County, and T. Hunt Mayfield, State's Attorney for Howard County, on the brief, for the appellee.
Decided November 8, 1961. Certiorari denied as to Charles R. Graves, 370 U.S. 956. Certiorari denied, 369 U.S. 855.
HENDERSON, J., delivered the opinion of the Court.
These are four appeals in one record from judgments and sentences entered after a jury found the appellants guilty of robbery with a dangerous and deadly weapon. The State has moved to dismiss the appeals of Boyd, Toland and Williams, on the ground that they failed to present in the record extract sufficient material to enable this Court to decide certain of the questions presented. But it is conceded that at least some of the points raised are properly before us and entitled to consideration. For this reason the motion to dismiss will be denied.
At about 1:30 A.M. on April 11, 1960, an armed robbery was perpetrated at the Spartan Club, Frederick County. Two men, armed with a pistol and sawed-off shotgun, entered...
